body.p: Some respondents to the Exposure Draft raised the following additional concerns on the allocation of goodwill for impairment testing purposes:

li.p: mandating that goodwill should be allocated to at least the segment level is inappropriate—it will often result in arbitrary allocations, and entities would need to develop new or additional reporting systems.

for convergence reasons, the level of the goodwill impairment test should be the same as the level in US Financial Accounting Standards Board Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 142 Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets (SFAS 142) (ie the reporting unit level).

cash‑generating units that constitute businesses with similar characteristics should, as is required by SFAS 142, be aggregated and treated as single units, notwithstanding that they may be monitored independently for internal purposes.
